discussion.content:
FERMI
Feature > Exporter > Record > Monitor > Interface
Steps
4
1
2
3
> How to configure NetFlow - Sample <
feature netflow
flow exporter exporter1
version 9
flow record record1
match ipv4 source address
match ipv4 destination address
collect counter bytes
flow monitor flow1
record record1
exporter exporter1
interface Eth1/1
IP flow monitor
IP address X.X.X.X/YY
no shutdown
!

comments.content: this is really helpful and right answer, find this cmd-description from here : https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/4_2/nx-os/system_management/configuration/guide/sm_nx_os_cli/sm_15netflow.html#wp1075703

Good luck and thanks exam topics for all the help :)

comments.content:
NetFlow Example Configuration
This example shows how to create a flow and apply it to an interface:

feature netflow
flow exporter ee
 version 9
flow record rr
 match ipv4 source address
 match ipv4 destination address
 collect counter bytes
 collect counter packets
flow monitor foo
 record rr
 exporter ee
interface Ethernet2/45
 ip flow monitor foo output
 ip address 10.20.1.1/24
 no shutdown

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
An engineer is implementing NetFlow on a Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switch.
Drag and drop the NetFlow commands from the left into the correct order they must be entered on the right.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

questions.answer_description: Peer-switch - Enables the vPC switch pair to appear as a single STP root in the Layer 2 topology. Use the no form of the command to disable the peer switch vPC topology. If both switches do not have peer-switch enable, the question is not informing the bridge-ID (mac-address + priority) to see which switch would be the root anyway.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The vPC peer-switch feature allows both vPC Peers to simultaneously act as the STP root.
With this feature enabled both vPC Peers will be able to process BPDUs, and theyâ€™ll use the vPC system MAC to appear as a single logical unit.
One of the requirements is that both vPC Peers must have the same STP priority configured.
This enhancement should only be used in the vPC Domain which is the root for all VLANs in the network.

The correct answer is A since the peer-switch is enabled.
Peer-switch - Enables the vPC switch pair to appear as a single STP root in the Layer 2 topology. Use the no form of the command to disable the peer switch vPC topology. If both switches do not have peer-switch enable, the question is not informing the bridge-ID (mac-address + priority) to see which switch would be the root anyway.

choices.C: N7K-1 preempts N7K-2 as the STP root.
choices.D: N7K-2 appears as the STP root.
choices.B: N7K-1 appears as the STP root.
choices.A: N7K-1 and N7K-2 appear as a single STP root.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The STP priority of N7K-1 and N7K-2 are the lowest in the network.
Which statement describes STP on the vPC?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
b and D are the ones

questions.question_text:
A network engineer is adding a Cisco HyperFlex data platform to the Cisco Intersight management portal.
Which two components are required for Intersight to claim the Cisco HyperFlex data platform? (Choose two.)
questions.answer_description:
In UCS Manager, browse to Admin -> Device Connector. Enable Intersight Management toggle button and get the Device ID and the Claim Code.
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/hyperconverged-infrastructure/hyperflex-hx-data-platform/214268-cisco-intersight-hyperflex-installatio.html

choices.A: to the HyperFlex Edge two-node cluster
choices.D: to an additional server with network access to HyperFlex Edge

discussion.content:
The answer is C
Both rooms must have independent network paths to Intersight (SaaS or Appliance), which 
serves as the cluster witness. Without independent paths, there is no ability to tolerate the loss of either room. For example, if the Internet connection for room #1 and room #2 is 
serviced out of room #1, it would be impossible for room #1 to fail and for the Internet in room #2 to remain operational. This strict requirement may disqualify some environments from using a 2-node 2-room design

Selected Answer: B
B is the one!

Hyperflex to the win!

questions.question_text: Where is the witness deployed in a two-node Cisco HyperFlex Edge deployment?

choices.D: It verifies the firmware update on the server.
choices.B: It activates the firmware on the next adapter boot.
choices.C: It updates the firmware on adapter 1/1/1 immediately.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
Updating and Activating the Firmware on an Adapter 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/CLI-User-Guides/Firmware-Mgmt/3-1/b_UCSM_CLI_Firmware_Management_Guide_3_1/b_UCSM_GUI_Firmware_Management_Guide_3_1_chapter_011.html

Selected Answer: B
b is correct
